title: Refactor ConfirmModal usage to useConfirmModal in various components, hooks, and providers

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/68799#issuecomment-3562885730...

### Problem
When every component mounts its own ConfirmModal in the component tree, it creates component bloat, memory overhead from multiple modal instances, and repetitive boilerplate code that makes the application harder to maintain.

### Solution
Refactor ConfirmModal usage to useConfirmModal in the following files:

```
ImportSpreadsheet.tsx
ImportSpreadsheetConfirmModal.tsx
DotIndicatorMessage.tsx
BookTravelButton.tsx
AccountSwitcher.tsx
ExportWithDropdownMenu.tsx
LocationPermissionModal/index.tsx
LocationPermissionModal/index.desktop.tsx
ContactPermissionModal/index.native.tsx
FocusModeNotification.tsx
SupportalPermissionDeniedModalProvider.tsx
DelegateNoAccessModalProvider.tsx
LockedAccountModalProvider.tsx
useFilesValidation.tsx
useCreateEmptyReportConfirmation.tsx
src/Expensify.tsx
TransactionReceiptModalContent.tsx
```

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>

title: [$250] Separate subtitle from report title push row

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
### Problem Currently when you view a report's details (and have the permissions necessary to edit the report title), you see a push row with the report title and subtitle in a single push row: But since you cannot edit the subtitle, it doesn't really make sense to include it in the push row. It also adds a second tap target to the push row that if accidentally tapped, could be super frustrating. ### Solution Let's update this screen to have these be two _separate_ rows. Instead of a single title push row with all the info, let's have a Title push row with the report's title, and a **read-only** From push row that shows the subtitle details.

  • Upwork Job ID: 1996339259157093777
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-12-03

Launch the app 2. Press the '+' button 3. Select 'create expense' > "Take photo" of reciept 4. Tap on "To" option 5. On the soft permission modal to import your contacts appears >Click on "Continue" 6. Click on the option to deny the access to the device contacts 7. Scroll down to the botton 8. Notice the "Import Contact" button is displayed but the list is autoscrolled and restarted ## Expected Result: The user should be able to tap the "Import Contacts" button without the list jumping or resetting ## Actual Result: When the user scrolls to the bottom of the contact list, the list automatically scrolls back to the top or resets its position. It becomes unreachable ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$125] Expense - Change approver option still exist after disabling approval feature in workflow

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you havent already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.71-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** testpayment935+ab1202@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11 pro /Chrome, Samsung Galaxy s10/ Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com. 2. Create a workspace. 3. Enable the Workflow setting and turn on the Add Approver and Payment toggles if they are not already enabled. 4. Create an expense in the workspace. 5. Submit the expense but do not approve it. 6. Open the More menu and notice that the Change Approver option is available. 7. Go to Workflow and disable the Add Approver option. 8. Note that the primary button changes to Pay button. 9. Open the More menu again. ## Expected Result: After the Approval option is disabled in Workflow, all related features should be removed from the More options menu ## Actual Result: The Change Approver option remains functional even when the approval feature is disabled in Workflow. Note: This option is only removed after retracting the submission and resubmitting the expense ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ba036c7f-53fa-4444-b04b-52d2adc74919 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Reports page shows `oops` error after reopening the App

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem 1. User is on the Reports page and backgrounds the App 2. After a while (maybe a full 15min), user reopens the App 3. User sees the Oops error page ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abe8a3f8-4b9f-4a65-9276-276b4d65c363) ### Solution Logs show the following: ``` Got an authorization error Expensify\Error\Auth\AuthTokenExpired - 9b953676-e64d-4262-bf74-1bf0ff888e4d ~~ command: 'Search' exceptionJsonCode: '407' exceptionUserMessage: 'Your session has expired. Please sign in again.' ``` The auth token is probably expiring and we're sending a request to Search before we re-authenticate the user, which leads to the request failing and the error showing. Make sure we re-authenticate first.
